title: Stephanopoulos's Donations To Clinton Foundation Set Social Media Abuzz
teaser: Julia Turner of Slate takes a look at how the week's news is reverberating online, including George Stephanopoulos's $75,000 in contributions.
contentencoded:
Here & Now’s Robin Young checks in with Julia Turner, editor-in-chief of Slate magazine, about what’s been buzzing on social media. The stories include:

  • The flap over “Good Morning America” anchor George Stephanopoulos’s $75,000 in contributions to the Clinton Foundation
  • Seymour Hersh’s article in the London Review which asserts that the Obama administration lied about the raid on Osama bin Laden. See Slate’s follow-up interview with Hersh, “I Am Not Backing Off Anything I Said.”
  • The flutter in the classical music Twittersphere over the fake tweets that Boston Symphony Orchestra leader Andris Nelsons was selected to take over the Berlin symphony.

Guest

  • Julia Turner, editor-in-chief of Slate. She tweets @juliaturner.
